data.title: Historic Italian Restaurant
data.text:
Anyone that lives in this city has been to this restaurant.  It has been around for a very long time and possesses the ambiance of an elegant restaurant the way they use to be. It also has a relaxed atmosphere and you're never rushed to finish a meal.

 It not only serves Italian food but if you aren't crazy about Italian, there are options. Anything they serve is wonderful. The portions are formidable, the staff accommodating and pleasant - the desserts are wonderful if you have the extra room.  It's a great place for parties, showers and business luncheons.

data.title: Great restaurant, but be patient
data.text: Amazing home cooked food with real Italian flavors. Big portions, great wine, but service is typically slow and drawn out. Don't go in a rush.

data.title: Delicious Food /Great Scenery
data.text: Located on the Merrimack River in Haverhill, Massachusetts, The Roma Restaurant offers up delicious food at a reasonable price. Highly recommended. A favorite of the locals

data.title: Get a Goupon coupon first
data.text: Two appetizers and two entrees, stuffed mushrooms were pretty good, buffalo wings were breaded and not so good. Baked haddock was dry and had little flavor, veal Marsala was OK.

data.title: Gave it too many tries. I'm done.
data.text: I ordered a Caesar salad and as a side with my meal. They brought me iceberg lettuce with about a cup of Parmesan cheese sprinkled on it. I said to the waitress "this is not a Caesar salad." Her response was, "I guess that's how they make it here." My haddock dinner came...the fish was translucent (not cooked) and cold. My baked potato was like a rock and cold. The waitress brought out another baked potato and it was just as bad and cold. She explained that the pre-bake the potatoes and then they sit in a bowl so that's why they were cold. You've got to be kidding me. My husband order veal Parmesan and it was so tough, he could hardly cut it with the knife. The waitress asked if everything was OK and did we want to wrap anything. Of course, we said no and she just left the bill. Nothing was deducted from the bill, no offer of apology....nothing. We've been there more than once just to give them a fair chance...won't do it again for sure.

data.title: good value on Mondays and Tuesdays
data.text: The baked haddock with the baked potato and side salad were fresh and delicious.  Everyone in our party was satisfied.  The waitress was attentive and let us sip our cocktails without rushing us to order. We definitely will return again.

data.title: Pasta is good and affordable, honest
data.text:
I have been coming to this restaurant since I moved to Haverhill over 13 years ago. And I have not given the place the best of reviews.
This time my fiancee and I give it good marks. She had the lazania and I had the chicken and eggplant parm. The interior is clean and nice. The service was excellent and the food came out quick. All the servers are dressed in black and are top rate.  Both entrees came with salad and side pasta. Pasta was al dented and for the first time I liked the sauce. Both entrees were biggie sized the way the New England love to eat BIG. Also nice bread...though not homemade and the dipping oil too sweet. The house Chianti is what your grandfathered liked. You may want to upgrade to a good bottle. This same meal at the other Italian place up the road would be close to 100 with tip. This bill came to 52.00 and I tip above 20%. So family of four or more must try this place out. I now get this place...good Italian food at a price that does not break the family budget. Good parking and safe. 
Tip: Try the Roma Veal....very tender.

data.title: The Roma Restaurant in Bradford
data.text: Good food at a reasonable price.  Their menu has something for everyone from Seafood to Steaks to Chicken Italian dishes. They offer private rooms for small gatherings and have a function hall upstairs.

data.title: What a Gem
data.text: I never would have discovered the Roma if it were not for a sad occasion. My friends in the Nici family loss the family matriarch, Audrey. To break bread after the funeral and burial ceremony the family had scheduled the luncheon at the Roma on the banks of the Merrimack River. Inasmuch as this was a limited menu selection because of the size of our group (~32) the staff accommodated the vegetarians by offering selections not on the event menu. They were so understanding and helpful. The quality of the food was excellent, I had the baked haddock and others at my table had the steak tips or chicken parm. All of us really enjoyed our meals. Highly recommend this venue even if a couple or group of four.

data.title: Parma chicken
data.text: I returned here after many years to find that it was as great as a remembered it.  I liked the take on the stuffed mushrooms with cheese and bread stuffing.  Fresh sliced bread on the table, salad and the Parma Chicken was so tasty and almost more than I could eat.  It's a nice Italian menu overall and the restaurant is tucked away on a quiet street by the water on the Bradford side of Haverhill.

data.title: Not what we expected...
data.text: When we arrived at 7pm, only 2 tables were filled. There were more staff members than patrons. Very awkward. Also, there was no music playing and it was very quiet. We almost felt like we had to whisper during dinner so others couldn't hear. There waitress immediately brought bread to the table (which looked like it was purchased from a local Market Basket). We ordered calamari and stuffed mushrooms for an appetizer. Both were mediocre. My side salad looked like it came from a bag (again from Market Basket). Our dinner was nothing special. Overall, we will not be returning and were disappointed by the experience. I wouldn't recommend the Roma.

data.title: Great service and delicious food.
data.text: We couldn't wait to return to Roma Restaurant because our first visit was really beyond outstanding. Our server was very attentive even after the restaurant started to fill up shortly after our arrival. I ordered the Pasta Fresca al Mare which was loaded with fresh seafood and delicious. I must admit this was the same dish I had on our first visit to Roma Restaurant but it was so good I couldn't help but order it again. My friend had the Gnocchi Con Salsiccia with Italian sausage, carmelized onions and potato gnocchi which he thoroughly enjoyed. Panam1961

data.title: its ok
data.text: we were going a lot but i think they keep changing cooks the food is really good sometimes they its terrible

data.title: Delish
data.text: This is the second time my Husband and I have been here and the food has been great both times. Service is good and atmosphere is comfortable.

data.title: Good prices
data.text: the menu has a good variety of a number of standard Italian entree options.  Mid-week offers most meals for just $9.99 which is a great economical dinner choice

data.title: Italian Style
data.text: Great portions of food. Our meals were delicious.  Thick & flavorful cutlets with a delicious s@uce. A must go for a nice dinner.

data.title: Good, not great
data.text: My lunchtime lasagna, which was good, not great, came with a large meatball.  It was necessary to order a salad separately.  Companions enjoyed their generous Caesar salads with steak tips.  Strawberry shortcake dessert was delicious.

data.title: Great food! Great price!
data.text:
This was our first visit last night to Roma Restaurant and we were not disappointed.
Our server was very pleasant and efficient. She took our cocktail orders withi
five minutes of being seated, in a booth I might ad, and she allowed us time to relax before we placed our meal orders.
I started with the Bruschetta and my friend opted for the Jumbo Potato Skins. Both were large portions and delicious. We ended up taking half of our appetizers home with us. For the  main course I had the Lamb Kebobs and my friend had the Large Atlantic Sea Scallops. We also had the garden salad with a delicious blue cheese dressing. Needless to say we didn't leave room for desert. Oh well, next time! PanAm1961

data.title: Excellent mealand service
data.text: We went to the Roma Restoraante for lunch.  Our food was excellent both in flavor and size.  Our server was prompt and courteous.  They has 2 large parties there while we were there (one that came with out reservations) but out meals were served with only a little delay.  Portion size was large and we had take home boxes.  They could use some updating of their decor but the place was clean.

data.title: Great menu reasonably priced
data.text:
We recently tried the Roma Restaurant over looking the river in the Bradford section of Haverhill for lunch. The menu was extensive, the service was courteous. We enjoyed the steak tips and chicken parm sandwich. Very tastie at reasonable prices.
The restaurant needs a little sprucing up as it appears dated.

All considered, we will return.
